title: Mobile-Based Instructional Design Process for Health Promotion in Children and Adolescents Undergoing Anticancer Treatment

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental medical terminology and mobile device utilization
context.additional_context: Application of contextual instructional design for delivering anticancer treatment support knowledge in a constrained technological environment (primarily smartphone-based)

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three strategies for managing side effects in pediatric and adolescent cancer patients.
Learners can apply nutrition management protocols to real-world scenarios using mobile apps.
Learners can demonstrate emotional support methods during treatment through role-playing.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
